rev.comment: mentioning the source is not available
rev.diff:
Line 34: Line 34:
==License==
==License==
â
MediaCoder used to be [[open source]] prior to 2008: these versions and [[Source code|sources]] were present on the former [[SourceForge]] page of [http://sourceforge.net/projects/mediacoder/ MediaCoder Project] (dead)<ref>[http://blog.mediacoderhq.com/mediacoder-is-no-longer-hosted-on-sourceforge-net/ MediaCoder is no longer hosted on SourceForge.net from this day on ]</ref>. The current license is [http://wiki.mediacoderhq.com/index.php/EULA MediaCoder EULA]. Following these changes, on 10 June 2009, a ticket was opened on [[FFmpeg|FFmpeg's]] development site, alleging "Possible MediaCoder GPL violation". Although the author of MediaCoder participated in the discussion, the issue has yet to be resolved.<ref>http://roundup.ffmpeg.org/roundup/ffmpeg/issue1162</ref>
+
MediaCoder used to be [[open source]] prior to 2008: these versions and [[Source code|sources]] were present on the former [[SourceForge]] page of [http://sourceforge.net/projects/mediacoder/ MediaCoder Project] (dead)<ref>[http://blog.mediacoderhq.com/mediacoder-is-no-longer-hosted-on-sourceforge-net/ MediaCoder is no longer hosted on SourceForge.net from this day on ]</ref>. The current license is [http://wiki.mediacoderhq.com/index.php/EULA MediaCoder EULA] and the source code is not available. Following these changes, on 10 June 2009, a ticket was opened on [[FFmpeg|FFmpeg's]] development site, alleging "Possible MediaCoder GPL violation". Although the author of MediaCoder participated in the discussion, the issue has yet to be resolved.<ref>http://roundup.ffmpeg.org/roundup/ffmpeg/issue1162</ref>
